PED590.name: Special Problems in Pediatrics
PED590.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year, Summer of every year
PED590.description: Experimental, theoretical, or applied problems under faculty direction.
PED590.restrictions: Open only to graduate-professional students in the College of Osteopathic Medicine. Approval of department.

PED600.name: Core Pediatrics Clerkship
PED600.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year, Summer of every year
PED600.description: Practical clinical exposure in the area of pediatrics.
PED600.restrictions: Open to graduate-professional students in the College of Osteopathic Medicine.

PED601.name: Pediatrics Specialty Clerkship
PED601.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year, Summer of every year
PED601.description: Clinical exposure in specialties of Pediatrics. Proficiency in motor skills and aptitudes; comprehension of concepts and principles; patient evaluation; diagnosis; management; therapy.
PED601.restrictions: Open to graduate-professional students in the College of Osteopathic Medicine.

PED602.name: Primary Care Ambulatory Clerkship
PED602.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year, Summer of every year
PED602.description: A 24-week ambulatory care continuity experience involving 12 weeks in a multidisciplinary environment (family medicine, pediatrics, and internal medicine), 4 weeks in family medicine and 8 weeks in specialty areas (internal medicine, surgery, pediatrics, and obstetrics and gynecology). Didactic sessions are scheduled concurrently.

PED603.restrictions: Open to graduate-professional students in the College of Osteopathic Medicine.
